availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky Native. Resided in Ohio County in 1850. Married Fannie Allen Kinney in Grayson County, Kentucky in 1856. Henderson County attorney in 1860. Major of the Twelfth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment, U.S.A. until resignation on February 12, 1863. Elected to the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in August 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, stamped p. 48. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 3. Thomas Speed, R. M. Kelly, and Alfred Pirtle, eds., Union Regiments of Kentucky, Vol. I (Louisville: Courier-Journal Job Printing Co., 1897), 236. Lewis Collins, Collins Historical Sketches of Kentucky: History of Kentucky, Vol I. (Covington, Ky.: Collins & Co, 1874), 116. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky, Roll #994036, Grayson County Marriages, p. 6.
